tuv.seg: Mental Health Act 2001
An tAcht Meabhair-Shláinte 2001
The Mental Health Act 2001 changed the rules about admission to psychiatric hospitals and the rights of psychiatric patients
D’athraigh An tAcht Meabhair-Shláinte 2001 na rialacha maidir le duine a ghlacadh isteach in ospidéil síciatracha agus cearta othar síciatrach
Since the Act was implemented on 1 November 2006, new procedures have been put in place for the monitoring and regulation of standards of care in psychiatric hospitals
Ó tháinig an tAcht i bhfeidhm an 1 Samhain 2006, tá nósanna imeachta nua curtha i bhfeidhm chun monaitóireacht agus rialú a dhéanamh ar na caighdeáin cúraim in ospidéil síciatracha
Best interests of the patient
Barr leas an othair

When people are admitted or are receiving treatment in approved centres (that is, psychiatric hospitals or inpatient services), their best interests should be considered before any decision about their care and treatment is made

Nuair a ghlactar daoine isteach san ionad ceadaithe nó nuair atá siad ag fáil cóireála in ionad ceadaithe (sé sin, ospidéil shíciatracha nó seirbhísí d’othair chónaitheacha), ní mór a leas a thabhairt san áireamh sula ndéantar aon cinneadh maidir lena gcúram nó a gcóireáil
They should be included in discussions with their care team about where their best interests lie to help them with their recovery
Ba chóir iad a thabhairt san áireamh i bpléití lena bhfoirne agus a mbarr leas á bplé agus chun cabhrú leo ina dtéarnamh
Patients have the right to be treated with dignity and respect and the right to be listened to by all those working on their care team
Tá sé de cheart ag othair go gcaithfí leo le dínit agus meas agus go n-éisteodh gach duine atá ag obair ar a bhfoireann chúraim leo
They are entitled to take part in decisions that affect their health and their care team should consider their views carefully
Tá sé de cheart acu a bheith páirteach i gcinntí a bhfuil tionchar acu ar a sláinte agus ba chóir don fhoireann chúraim a gcuid tuairimí a bhreithniú go cúramach
They have the right to be fully informed about their legal rights, their admission and treatment
Tá sé de cheart acu a bheith go hiomlán ar an eolas faoin a gcearta dlí, a nglacadh isteach san ospidéal agus a gcóireáil
The Mental Health Commission has been in existence since 2002
Tá an Coimisiún Meabhair-Shláinte ar an bhfód ó 2002
Its main functions are:
Seo a leanas na príomhfheidhmeanna atá aige:
• To promote, encourage and foster high standards and good practices in the delivery of mental health services and
• Caighdeáin arda agus dea-chleachtais a chur chun cinn, a spreagadh agus a chothú i seachadadh seirbhísí meabhair-shláinte
• To protect the interests of people who have been involuntarily admitted to an approved centre
and • Leas na ndaoine a glacadh isteach go neamhdheonach chuig ionad ceadaithe a chosaint
It is responsible for implementing the provisions of the Act in relation to involuntary admission, for setting up mental health tribunals and ensuring that the rights of patients are respected
Tá sé freagrach as forálacha an Achta a chur i bhfeidhm maidir le glacadh isteach neamhdheonach , as binsí meabhair-shláinte a shocrú suas agus as a chinntiú go bhfuil meas ar chearta na n-othar
It has drawn up the forms necessary for the various processes and issued guidelines for people involved in the mental health system
Tá na foirmeacha a bhfuil gá leo dréachtaithe aige maidir leis na próisis éagsúla agus na treoirlínte eisithe aige do dhaoine a bhfuil baint acu leis an gcóras meabhair-shláinte
The Mental Health Commission has published a guide to the Mental Health Act 2001 which is available in English, Irish, Arabic, Chinese, French, Polish and Russian
Tá treoir maidir leis an Acht Meabhair-Shláinte 2001 foilsithe ag an gCoimisiún Meabhair-Shláinte agus í ar fáil i mBéarla, Gaeilge, Araibis, Sínis, Fraincis, Polainnis agus Rúisis
